content.raw: I was relying that the constructor already calls it, but the constructor is not inside a test it is in the `beforeEach`, I'll try to all it again in the `initialize test` and see if it brings up any problems then.
content.html: I was relying that the constructor already calls it, but the constructor is not inside a test it is in the beforeEach, I'll try to all it again in the initialize test and see if it brings up any problems then.

content.raw: The tests are passing for me, nice job! I left a few comments about other tests we could add, but I'm ok with leaving them for future pull requests if you prefer. Approving!
content.html: The tests are passing for me, nice job! I left a few comments about other tests we could add, but I'm ok with leaving them for future pull requests if you prefer. Approving!

content.raw:
Interesting that `scene.setPose` doesn't care whether the model is on the scene or not.

Do you mind adding another small test that adds and removes a model from the scene? Using `GZ3D.Scene.prototype.add` and `GZ3D.Scene.prototype.remove`
content.html:
Interesting that scene.setPose doesn't care whether the model is on the scene or not.

Do you mind adding another small test that adds and removes a model from the scene? Using GZ3D.Scene.prototype.add and GZ3D.Scene.prototype.remove

content.raw: Could we add a test that exercises `GZ3D.Scene.prototype.initScene`? According to the test coverage this function is not being tested.
content.html: Could we add a test that exercises GZ3D.Scene.prototype.initScene? According to the test coverage this function is not being tested.

content.raw: The sdfparser's constructor calls `this.scene.setSDFParser(this);`, so I think technically we don't need to call it again. This is probably something which can be improved on the API, because I don't think passing an sdfparser created with one scene to another scene by calling `setSDFParser` will work properly.
content.html: The sdfparser's constructor calls this.scene.setSDFParser(this);, so I think technically we don't need to call it again. This is probably something which can be improved on the API, because I don't think passing an sdfparser created with one scene to another scene by calling setSDFParser will work properly.

content.raw: Ah I see, Ok will try that.
content.html: Ah I see, Ok will try that.

content.html: Here we could try all the manipulation modes. I wonder if we can also check scene.modelManipulator

content.html: Missing a z

content.raw: Yeah We can, I'm waiting until  the branch ```test_model_spawning``` is done.
content.html: Yeah We can, I'm waiting until the branch test_model_spawning is done.

content.raw:
If I added the ```done()``` the second test then fails.
 I removed the done because I wanted jasmine to wait in the first test until the time out ```jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL = 1000;``` so that when the second test starts the ```modelStats```  would have be calculated.
content.html: If I added the done() the second test then fails. I removed the done because I wanted jasmine to wait in the first test until the time out jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL = 1000; so that when the second test starts the modelStats would have be calculated.

content.raw: On branch `test_model_spawning`, I am able to get rid of the `length` error by adding a `done()` in the end of the test. Is there a reason you're not calling done?
content.html: On branch test_model_spawning, I am able to get rid of the length error by adding a done() in the end of the test. Is there a reason you're not calling done?

content.raw: I think it's ok to test things separately now, we can think  of more elaborate integration tests in the future.
content.html: I think it's ok to test things separately now, we can think of more elaborate integration tests in the future.

content.raw: We could try moving this block into `beforeEach` and remove it from line 13. As I inderstand it, `beforeEach` is run once before each `describe`, so we get a new scene per test.
content.html: We could try moving this block into beforeEach and remove it from line 13. As I inderstand it, beforeEach is run once before each describe, so we get a new scene per test.
